title: Senior Class Photo, Independence High School, 1901
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace, and Charles Ross, among others, posing for high school graduating class photo, Independence, Missouri, 1901.  Back row: Henry Chiles; Elmer Twyman; William Lloyd Garrett; Harry Truman; Will Long; Myrtle Cronkhite; Laura Ford; Mary Anderson; Gertrude Dixon; Laura Kingsbury.  Third row: Crawford Compton; Leura Walters; Katie Krey; Gertrude Reyner.  Second row: Tasker P. Taylor; Louretta Meador; Minnie Carpenter; Grace Crandall; Mary Taylor; James T. Brown; Mary Chinn; Itaska Atkinson; Bertha Roberts; Bess Wallace.  Front row: Charles Ross; Nellie Caldwell; Emily Witschie; Faith Slichter; Lizzie Gossett; Minnie Robinson; Ruth Knapp; Agnes Roberts; Mary Womack. Original of this photograph is 71-2401. Donor: Mrs. H. W. Jefferson.

title: Truman with soldiers in France, World War I
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and some men of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery in a picture taken in France at the Chateau de Montigny-sur-Aube after the end of World War I. Truman is third from the right. Standing next to Truman, holding a magazine, is Captain Luther E. Wood (109th Field Artillery, Keystone Division). Donor: Ralph E. Truman

title: Truman at summer camp
Scopenote: Major Harry S. Truman (foreground, with mustache) at Reserve Officers' Summer Camp at Fort Riley. Others in photo are unidentified.

title: Louis W. Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of Louis W. Truman, son of General Ralph E. Truman.  Donor: R. E. Truman-35th Division Collection.

title: Truman standing next to 1929 Studebaker
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman with a 1929 Studebaker 8 car.

title: Truman on a horse
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman on a horse during a trip to the Ozarks, about 1933.

title: Truman in Senate office
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman in his office in Washington, D. C.

title: Senator Truman during the Truman Committee hearings
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman is shown in 1942 at a session of the United State Senate's special committee to investigate the national defense program, of which he was chairman.  Pictured from left to right at the counsel table are James M. Mead, Senator from New York; Charles Patrick Clark, associate Chief Counsel; Senator Truman; and Owen Brewster, Senator from Maine.

title: Truman hunting with F. Ryan Duffy
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (right) on a deer hunting trip in Pennsylvania with former Senator F. Ryan Duffy (left) of Wisconsin.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman in Kitchen of Washington D. C. Apartment
Scopenote: A photograph of Bess Truman (at sink) and Margaret Truman (right) in the apartment at 4701 Connecticut Avenue in Washington, D. C. where they lived with Senator Harry S. Truman.  This was taken as part of a series of photographs showing a typical day in the life of Senator Truman.

title: Truman in Senate
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman in a Senate anteroom.

title: Vice Presidential Candidate Harry S. Truman at Lunch with President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Vice Presidential Candidate Harry S. Truman (left) is at lunch with President Franklin D. Roosevelt (right) on the White House lawn.

title: President Roosevelt, Senator Truman, and Vice President Wallace
Scopenote: From left to right in backseat of car, President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Vice President-elect Harry S. Truman, and Vice President Henry A. Wallace seated before a bank of microphones in an open car at Union Station in Washington, D.C., a few days after the election. All others unidentified.

title: Photograph of Martha Ellen Truman, President Truman's mother, standing by a fireplace
Scopenote: A photograph of President Harry S Truman's mother, Martha Ellen Truman, standing by a fireplace.

title: Eddie Jacobson in Westport Men's Wear Company
Scopenote: Edward (Eddie) Jacobson, ex-partner of Harry S. Truman in the haberdashery business, now runs the Westport Men's Wear Company at 39th and Main in Kansas City, Missouri.  He has two daughters.  One is married to a Major in the Medical Corps in ETO, the other daughter played the piano with Mr. Truman when he used to visit them.

title: Portrait of Bess Truman
Scopenote: A recent portrait of Bess Truman, wife of the new U. S. President, distributed by the Office of War Information.    See also 68-1323 for same photo.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awarding Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Truman is shown awarding the Congressional Medal of Honor to Sergeant Jake Lindsey, Lucedale, Mississippi during an award ceremony held during a joint session of Congress.  Sergeant Lindsey is the 100th soldier to receive the award. Watching the ceremony standing on the right behind President Truman is General of the Army George C. Marshall.  On the rostrum is Kenneth McKellar, far left, President Pro Tempore of the Senate and on the right Sam Rayburn, Speaker of the House.  Others in view are not identified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown awarding the 100th Congressional Medal of Honor to Sergeant Jake Lindsey, Lucedale, Mississippi, in a ceremony before a joint session of Congress.  General George C. Marshall is shown standing directly behind President Truman and Colonel Harry Vaughan, Military Aide to the President, is standing in uniform on the far left.  On the rostrum in the background is Senator Kenneth McKellar, left, President Pro Tempore of the Senate and Speaker of the House Same Rayburn next to him. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Herbert Hoover
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with former President Herbert Hoover at the White House. Mr. Hoover, who was Relief Commissioner in Europe and Federal Food Administrator during World War I, conferred with President Truman on the food situation in the United States and Europe.

title: Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: The Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri, built in 1933.  It was here that Harry Truman presided as county judge before he was elected to the Senate in 1935.  His office was on the first floor in the wing closest to the camera.  From:  National Archives.

title: President Truman and General Carl A. Spaatz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and General Carl A. (Tooey) Spaatz, Commanding General of Strategic Air Forces in Europe, are shown speaking in the Oval Office of the White House.  The General returned to his home in Alexandria, Virginia yesterday and called on the President today.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients and Families
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing outside the White House with Congressional Medal of Honor recipients (front row) their family members, and military officials. From left to right, front row: Major Everett P. Pope, United States Marine Corps North Quincy and Wollaston, Massachusetts; Private First Class Gino J. Merli, United States Army, Peckville, Pennsylvania; Laurett Graham (niece of Lieutenant Rouh); Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr., United States Marine Corps, Henderson and Brownsville, Kentucky; and First Lieutenant Carlton Rouh, United States Marine Corps, Lindenwold, New Jersey. Left to right, second row: unknown; General George Marshall; President Truman; General Alexander A. Vandegrift, Commandant, Marine Corps; and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients and Their Families
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands outside the White House with Congressional Medal of Honor recipients (front row) their family members, and military officials. From left to right, front row: Major Everett P. Pope, United States Marine Corps, North Quincy and Wollaston, Massachusetts; Private First Class Gino J. Merli, United States Army, Peckville, Pennsylvania; Laurett Graham (niece of Lieutenant Rouh); Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr., United States Marine Corps, Henderson and Brownsville, Kentucky; and First Lieutenant Carlton Rouh, United States Marine Corps, Lindenwold, New Jersey. Left to right, second row: unknown; General George Marshall; President Truman; General Alexander A. Vandegrift, Commandant, Marine Corps; and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards the Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to Marine Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr., of Henderson, Kentucky. This award was presented to this soldier and three others this day at a ceremony on the White House grounds. PFC Skaggs kept fighting for eight hours in the Guam landing, July, 1944, despite serious wounds which later cost him his left leg.  Standing next to President Truman is Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, standing, center, poses with some of the 28 Congressional Medal of Honor recipients during a mass presentation ceremony in the East Room of the White House.  The men were honored for their bravery during World War II. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown bestowing the Congressional Medal of Honor on Sergeant Ralph G. Neppel, 21, Glidden, Iowa.  Sgt. Neppel is one of 28 soldiers who received this award in the East Room of the White House on this day.  Sgt. Neppel lost his legs below the knee in action in Germany, December, 1944.

title: Truman With Madame Chiang Kai-shek
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meeting with Madame Chiang Kai-shek (right) in the Oval Office of the White House.

title: Truman receiving desk sign
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, wearing a Shrine fez presented to him by Imperial Shrine Potentate William Woodfield of San Francisco, California, holds a sign that Mr. Woodfield also presented.  The sign is triangular and has "Yes," "No," and "Scram," each written on one of the three sides.  Mr. Truman is displaying the side that says "Scram."

title: President Harry S. Truman with Japanese Surrender Document
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds the original surrender document signed by the Japanese dignitaries aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay on September 2, 1945. Standing from left to right are: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, General George C. Marshall, and President Truman. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents the Medal of Honor to Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (lower, center) presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to Commander George L. Street, US Navy, during a ceremony at the White House. Shown here is a general view of the mass medal presentation ceremony on the White House south lawn in which 14 men of the U.S. Marine Corps and Navy received the award for bravery in World War II. The Washington Monument is in view in the background as well as numerous U.S. Navy and Marine officials, soldiers and family members.

title: President Truman Presents Medal of Honor to Desmond T. Doss
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to Corporal Desmond T. Doss, Lynchburg, Virginia, during a mass Medal of Honor presentation ceremony held at the White House gardens. Corporal Doss, a conscientious objector, earned the citation while serving as a medical corpsman with the 77th Division on Okinawa during World War II.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor to Recipient
Scopenote: This is a general view of the mass Congressional Medal of Honor presentation ceremony held in the White House Garden in which fifteen servicemen were awarded the Honor.  President Harry S. Truman is shown here, center, presenting the award to Corporal Thomas E. Atkins, Campobello, South Carolina.  Includes partial view of the south side of the White House and the West Executive Office Building.  General George C. Marshall is seated on the far right, second from the left. Major General Harry Vaughan is standing next to the United States glad near the table holding the medals. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Addresses Congress on Universal Military Training
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in a speech today before a Joint Session of Congress, called for one year of military training as opposed to military service, for every male American.  The training would begin at 18 years of age or upon graduation from high school.  The President said that although the U. S. will use all it's moral influence to maintain the peace, the nation must face the fact that peace must be built on power as well as good will.  Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn is at right in background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor to Recipient
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to United States Navy Lieutenant Richard Miles McCool, Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard M. McCool, Sr., Norman, Oklahoma, who were present at the ceremony as well as Lieutenant McCool's wife.  His award was presented for service as commanding officer of the USS LCS (Landing Craft Support) 122 during operations against Japanese forces in the Ryukyu Chain, June 10 and 11, 1945.

title: Photograph of Martha E. Truman and Mary Jane Truman
Scopenote: Mother Martha E. Truman, sister (of Harry) Mary Jane Truman in their home at Grandview.

title: President Harry S. Truman Congratulates Medal of Honor Recipient
Scopenote: Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan, right, of the United States Navy's Chaplain Corps is congratulated by President Harry S. Truman after the President awarded him the Congressional Medal of Honor.  This sailor Catholic priest, the first chaplain ever to receive the award, was cited for his efforts after the aircraft carrier USS Franklin was bombed near Japan in March, 1945.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipient
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan, Catholic chaplain on board the carrier the USS Franklin. Commander O'Callahan risked his life to administer last rites to the dying on board the USS Franklin after it was attacked by Japanese suicide planes during World War II.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Four Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman joins hands with two soldiers and two sailors who served during World War II and have just received the Congressional Medal of Honor. From left to right: Sergeant John R. McKinney, Woodcliff, Georgia; First Lieutenant Daniel W. Lee, Alma, Georgia; President Truman; Lieutenant Donald A. Gary, Oakland, California; and Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan, Navy Chaplain. The ceremony took place in the Oval Office at the White House.

title: President Truman with Byrnes and Smith
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (center) and General Walter Bedell Smith (right), the newly appointed Ambassador to the Soviet Union.

title: President Harry S. Truman Stands With Two Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: In ceremonies held on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman, center, awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to the two men standing on either side of him.  They include U.S. Army Master Sergeant Charles L. McGaha, Cosby, Tennessee, on the left, and U.S. Navy submarine skipper Commander Richard H. O'Kane, Dover, New Hampshire, on the right.  The two wounded soldiers in wheelchairs were invited guests to the ceremony.  They include left to right:  Private First Class Robert Gordon, Cincinnati, Ohio, and Sergeant Joseph Segar, McLean, Virginia.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: In ceremonies on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman, center, awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to two men standing with him who served in World War II.  They include left to right: U.S. Army Master Sergeant Charles L. McGaha, Cosby, Tennessee and U.S. Navy Commander Richard H. O'Kane, Dover, New Hampshire, a submarine skipper.  Three wounded soldiers as seen here in wheelchairs were invited guests to the ceremony.  Two are identified.  They are left to right:  Private First Class Robert Gordon, Cincinnati, Ohio and Sergeant Joseph Segar, McLean, Virginia. The soldier on the far right is unidentified.

title: President Truman Buys CARE Package to Feed Europe's Hungry People
Scopenote: In a Rose Garden ceremony at the White House, President Harry S. Truman hands a check for $1500 to Lt. General William N. Haskell to pay for 100 CARE packages of food to be sent to 10 heads of state in Europe for distribution among the hungry. Haskell is Executive Director of Cooperative for American Remittances to Europe, Inc. (CARE) a non-profit organization whose purpose is to supplement the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA) and act as a means for the whole country to provide a hungry person in Europe with food enough for three or four weeks.

title: Former President Hoover, President Truman, and Clinton P. Anderson
Scopenote: Former President Herbert Hoover, recently back from a world food mission, at the White House submitting his personal report to President Truman. Left to right: President Harry S. Truman, Mr. Hoover and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Korean Vase
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a 900-year-old vase from Dr. E. W. Chang, head of the Coseoul Normal College of Korea (right). The vase is a gift to the American People. Dr. Chang visited the United States as the head of a Korean mission to study American educational methods.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Wounded Soldiers
Scopenote: A portion of the group of forty disabled soldiers and their attendants from Walter Reed Hospital are shown here as guests attending Congressional Medal of Honor ceremonies held on the White House lawn. President Harry S. Truman is shaking hands with Robert Soly, Cambridge, Massachusetts, while on the far right awaiting his turn is Arthur Hook, Rochester, New York.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: In a group medal presentation ceremony held in the White House south grounds garden, President Harry S. Truman awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to four U.S. Army men and one U.S. Marine. Pictured sharing a handshake after the ceremony are left to right: Sergeant Alejandro R. Ruiz, Barstow, Texas; Technical Sergeant Beauford T. Anderson, Soldiers Grove, Wisconsin; Private First Class Dirk J. Vlug, Grand Rapids, Michigan; President Truman; Technical Sergeant John Meagher, Jersey City, New Jersey; and First Lieutenant John H. Leims, United States Marine Corps, Chicago, Illinois. These men were honored for their efforts in fighting on Okinawa and Iwo Jima during World War II.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: In a group medal presentation ceremony held in the White House south grounds garden, President Harry S. Truman awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to four U.S. Army men and one U.S. Marine. Pictured here sharing a handshake after the ceremony are left to right: Sergeant Alejandro R. Ruiz, Barstow, Texas; Technical Sergeant Beauford T. Anderson, Soldiers Grove, Wisconsin; Private First Class Dirk J. Vlug, Grand Rapids, Michigan; President Truman; Technical Sergeant John Meagher, Jersey City, New Jersey; and First Lieutenant John H. Leims, United States Marine Corps, Chicago, Illinois. These men were honored for their efforts in fighting on Okinawa and Iwo Jima during World War II.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shaking Hands With Wounded
Scopenote: A group of forty disabled soldiers and their attendants from Walter Reed Hospital are partially shown here as guests attending Congressional Medal of Honor ceremonies held on the White House lawn.  President Harry S. Truman is shaking hands with Private First Class Samuel J. Barressi, Corry, Pennsylvania.  Others in view are not identified.

title: President Truman and former President Hoover
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with former President Hoover, recently returned from a trip to South America. Hoover reported on the world food situation as representatives of 18 nations met to form an international emergency food council to chart the fight against hunger into 1947.

title: Truman at Hampton Roads, Virginia
Scopenote: From left to right, an unidentified sailor, Captain James Foskett, George Allen, and President Harry S. Truman on the flying bridge of the U.S.S. Williamsburg in Hampton Roads, Virginia.  Picture from the President's vacation cruise album.

title: President Truman on the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party assemble on the flying bridge as the U.S.S. Williamsburg enters the Narragansett Bay.  From the album: The President's Vacation Cruise.

title: Crew of the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Entering Bermuda, Captain Charles L. Freeman, Commander Bartos, Commander Stirwalt, and Bermuda pilots on the U.S.S. Williamsburg bridge. From the album: The President's Vacation Cruise.

title: President Truman in his bathrobe on Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman returns from his first morning swim. He is on the U. S. S. Williamsburg en route to Bermuda. From the album:  The President's Vacation Cruise.

title: Clark Clifford naps aboard the U. S. S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Clark Clifford (right) and Colonel Wallace Graham relax as they return from the fishing grounds. From the album: The President's Vacation Cruise.

title: President Harry S. Truman Welcomes Saudi Arabian Delegates to the United Nations General Assembly
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman greet representatives of Saudi Arabia at a reception at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City for delegates to the United Nations General Assembly which is convening for the first time in the United States.  Left to right in the receiving line: James H. Foskett, Naval Aide to the President; Bess Truman; President Truman; General Harry Vaughan, Military Aide to the President.  All others are unidentified.

title: Oscar Ivanissevich and President Truman View Painting of General San Martin, a Gift from Argentina
Scopenote: Oscar Ivanissevich, Argentina Ambassador (left), and President Harry S. Truman view a painting of General Jose De San Martin, South American Liberator.  The painting was a gift from the President of Argentina, Juan Peron.  (NARA number for photo:  208-PC-205 A 47)

title: The Presidential motorcade at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: The motorcade of President Harry S. Truman enters the Submarine Base, Key West as station personnel stand at attention along the route. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman arrives at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives at the Naval Air Station in Boca Chica, Florida, deplaning from the "Sacred Cow." From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and party disembarking at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman descends from his plane at Key West, followed by Captain James Foskett, Clark Clifford, Charlie Ross, and Edwin Locke. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: Sailors watching the Presidential motorcade at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: The personnel of the Submarine Base, Key West "man the rail" for President Harry S. Truman's motorcade. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and Admiral Leahy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Admiral William Leahy proudly display the day's catch. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Kew West, Florida.

title: President Truman and party walking in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Captain James Foskett, and Edwin Locke leave for a deep sea fishing trip. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: General Graham and Edwin Locke on the beach
Scopenote: General Wallace Graham and Edwin Locke toss a medicine ball around on the beach. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and Captain Foskett on the way to the pool
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Captain James Foskett walk to the swimming pool on the submarine base. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman in the pool, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman enjoys a swim in the Submarine Base swimming pool. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman driving from the Base Commandant's house
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman takes the wheel and with his passengers, Admiral C.W. Styer, Captain James Foskett, Edwin Locke, and Charlie Ross, drives off from the Submarine Base Commandant's house. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and guests driving to Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stops the motorcade at a scenic spot on the highway to Key West after going to Boca Chica to meet additional guests who arrived late.  In the front seat, left to right: unidentified, Admiral William Leahy, President Truman.  Back seat, left to right: Harry Vaughan, Judge John Caskie Collet, and John Steelman.  From the album "The President's Trip to Key West, Florida."

title: President Truman inspects radar equipment
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is shown magnetic airborne detector equipment, with officers looking on. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman greets Naval officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets officers standing by a sonar buoy and its equipment. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman posing with officers at the submarine base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, and Admiral C.W. Styer pose with officers at the Submarine Base at Key West. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: Truman disembarking the Dolphin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman steps off the U. S. S. Dolphin.  From the album, "The President's Vacation Trip to Key West, Florida".

title: President Truman and party aboard a submarine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party, sitting on the conning tower of the Submarine U-2513, watching exercises of the U.S.S. Wilke. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: Truman and party aboard the Dolphin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party on the Dolphin en route to the Anti-Submarine Development Squadron Base, Key West, Florida.  Seated next to President Truman is Admiral William Leahy.  The man in white standing is possibly Clark Clifford.  From the album, "The President's Vacation Trip to Key West, Florida."

title: President Truman aboard a submarine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tries out a pair of German-made binoculars aboard the submarine U-2513. From the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and company aboard the U.S.S. Stribling
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral C.W. Styer, Captain James Foskett, and Bill Saunders on the bow of the U.S.S. Stribling. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman fishing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman lands a six pound grouper off the stern of the Dolphin while fishing off Dry Tortugas, Florida.  From the album, "The President's Vacation Trip to Key West, Florida".

title: President Truman and others fishing
Scopenote: Captain Bra Saunders, a 70 year old fishing guide, unhooks a three pound yellowtail for President Harry S. Truman (center).  Captain James Foskett prepares to make his bid.  From the album "The President's Vacation Trip to Key West, Florida".

title: Fort Jefferson as seen from the sea
Scopenote: Fort Jefferson National Monument, at Dry Tortugas, Florida, as seen from the sea. From the album of President Harry S. Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman touring Fort Jefferson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party view the area atop the structure of Fort Jefferson. From the album of the President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman touring Fort Jefferson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Charlie Ross, Clark Clifford, John Steelman, Harry Vaughan, Edward A. Locke, Admiral C.W. Styer, John Caskie Collet, James Foskett, Lieutenant Colonel Myers, Captain W. A. Saunders and his son, Bill Saunders, and Secret Service Agents take a tour of Fort Jefferson conducted by Russell A. Gibbs, custodian. From the album of The President's vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: The enlisted men's beach at Key West
Scopenote: A wide angle shot of the enlisted men's beach at Key West. Fort Taylor is in the background. From the album of President Harry S. Truman's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: US Naval submarine base in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's flag flies atop the Administration Building at the U.S. Naval Submarine Base at Key West, Florida. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: The Presidential Party relaxing under the palms at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Admiral James Foskett, John Steelman, Neal Helm, President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, and Charles Ross relax under the palm trees in the Little White House garden, Key West, Florida. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman and Admiral Leahy weigh fish at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Admiral William Leahy (left) at the official judging of the largest fish during the Key West International Fishing Tournament's White House Sweepstakes. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman visits Fort Taylor, Florida
Scopenote: Under the guidance of Commander Scanland and Captain W.A. Saunders, President Harry S. Truman inspects Fort Taylor, an inactivated Army fort. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman poses by field gun, Fort Taylor, Florida
Scopenote: A French 75mm field gun at Fort Taylor reminds President Harry S. Truman of his World War I days. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman wins a fishing trophy in Boca Chica, Florida
Scopenote: Virginia Kelly, Queen of the 1947 Key West International Fishing Tournament, presents President Harry S. Truman his trophy. From the album of the President's second vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family Visit Canada
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his family posed for pictures at Rideau Hall, the official residence of the Governor General of Canada, shortly after their arrival in Canada. Standing from left to right are: Margaret Truman, President Truman, the Viscountess Alexander, Prime Minister of Canada William Mackenzie King, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Viscount Alexander, the Governor General of Canada.

title: President Truman and Secretary Marshall on the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: Followed by Secretary of State George Marshall, President Harry S. Truman proceeds to his quarters aboard the U. S. S. Missouri.  From the album, "President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro".

title: President Truman greets President Dutra of Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greeting President Eurico Gaspar Dutra of Brazil as he boards the U. S. S. Missouri.  From the album, "President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro".

title: President Truman being piped aboard the Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman piped aboard the U. S. S. Missouri, prior to receiving President Dutra of Brazil for lunch aboard the ship during President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.  From the album, "President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro".

title: President Truman greets Brazil's President Dutra
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greeting President Eurico Gaspar Dutra of Brazil as he boards the U.S.S. Missouri.  From the album, "President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro".

title: Margaret Truman, Stanley Woodward, General Foskett and General Vaughan playing deck tennis
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman and President Harry S. Truman followed the fast action of a deck tennis game on the U. S. S. Missouri.  Margaret Truman and Stanley Woodward teamed up against Admiral James Foskett and General Harry Vaughan.  From the album, President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro.

title: President Truman inspects soldiers aboard the U.S.S. Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, accompanied by Admiral James Foskett, inspects soldiers aboard the U.S.S. Missouri.    From the album, President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro.

title: Margaret Truman and Stanley Woodward playing deck tennis
Scopenote: Margaret Truman and Stanley Woodward (pictured) teamed up against Admiral James Foskett and General Harry Vaughan for a game of deck tennis on the U. S. S. Missouri.  From the album, President Truman's visit to Rio de Janeiro.

title: President Truman Inspects the Personnel of the U.S.S. Missouri

Potofsky.

As a result he was imprisoned. He escaped and joined the French Resistance. The Anderson House (home to the Society of the Cincinnati) served as a major event venue during the Harry S. Truman White House renovation. From the Department of State Album: "Visit of the Queen of the Netherlands to the United States of America, April 2 to April 21, 1952"

title: President Truman Greets Zylka Family
Scopenote: A family of displaced persons, the last to immigrate to America under the DP Act of 1948, is welcomed by President Harry S. Truman in the Rose Garden of the White House. They are Josef Zylka (2nd from right), a Polish National and former slave laborer, his wife Ursula Zylka, and their two daughters Ursula Zylka (6), and Beate Zylka (3). John W. Gibson, Chairman of the Displaced Persons Commission, stands behind Mrs. Zylka. Others are unidentified.

title: Queen Juliana on the Set of "Plymouth Adventure"
Scopenote: Her Royal Majesty Queen Juliana of the Netherlands meets icons of the motion picture industry on the set of the movie "Plymouth Adventure." From left to right are actors Van Johnson and Spencer Tracy, Queen Juliana, producer Dore Schary, and an unidentified man. From the Department of State Album: "Visit of the Queen of the Netherlands to the United States of America, April 2 to April 21, 1952"

title: President Truman waves to crowd
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves to the crowd from the reviewing stand at the 35th Division Reunion in Springfield, Missouri.  Shown are: Frank Spina, Harry S. Truman, General Robert Landry, Mary Jane Truman.

title: President Truman reviewing troops
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviewing troops at Springfield, Missouri, during the reunion of the 35th Division Association.  Inspection of honor guard at the airport.  With President Truman are Admiral Robert Dennison, General Harry Vaughan, and General Ralph E. Truman.  U. S. Army photo - 6th Armored Division, Fort Leonard Wood, Missouri

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Walking Down the Hallway of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) is walking down the hallway of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri. With him are, from left to right: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Earl Warren, Bess W. Truman, and President Lyndon B. Johnson. Others in the background are unidentified. They have just attended a ceremony announcing the creation of the Harry S. Truman Center for the Advancement of Peace at Hebrew University in Jerusalem.
